laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hematocrit decreased to 25.4%, Hemoglobin to 8.6 g/dL, White-cell count at one point decreased to 6,500 per mm³, and Platelet count fluctuated with significant drops (e.g., to 1,000 per mm³) after discharge.
Reticulocyte count increased to 16.6% after a significant drop in Hemoglobin; decreased to 2.9% later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive at one point, then negative later.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially positive, later again positive, indicating fluctuation in reaction over time.
IgG levels were later recorded as 734 mg/dL and 807 mg/dL, indicating an increase over time.
The presence of 16.6% of TCRαβ+ double-negative T cells was diagnostic of ALPS.
